intro: Heterotrichum racemosum, commonly known as the clustered moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows on moist, shaded surfaces such as rocks, soil, and tree trunks. The plant has a distinctive growth pattern with dense clusters of leaves that are often arranged in a spiral. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a single vein, which is a characteristic feature of many liverworts. Heterotrichum racemosum plays an important role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its natural habitat.
